com.apigee.flow.message
Interface Message

public interface Message

 A protocol independent representation of a message. Any protocol
 specific data associated with the message should be retrieved using
 the getVariable(String)} method with a property name

Method Summary

getHeaderNames

java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getHeaderNames()

getHeader

java.lang.String getHeader(java.lang.String headerName)
Get the header value. Equivalent to getHeader(headerName, 1)

Parameters:
headerName - the name of the header to retrieve
Returns:
the value associated with the header name, the first value in case the header has multiple values associated with it

getHeader

java.lang.String getHeader(java.lang.String headerName,
                           int index)
Get a particular value of a multivalued header

Parameters:
headerName - the name of the multivalued header
index - the index of the value to get. Index starts from 1.
Returns:
the (index)th value of the multivalued header

getHeaders

java.util.List<java.lang.String> getHeaders(java.lang.String headerName)
Get all the values of a header

Parameters:
headerName - the name of the header to retrieve
Returns:
the set of values associated with the header

getHeadersAsString

java.lang.String getHeadersAsString(java.lang.String headerName)
Get all the values of a header as string. the string is constructed using transport specific separator

Parameters:
headerName - the name of the header to retrieve
Returns:
the set of values associated with the header

setHeader

boolean setHeader(java.lang.String name,
                  java.lang.Object value)
Set the value of a header. Any existing values will be removed

Parameters:
name - of the header
value - the header value
Returns:
true if the header was set

setHeader

                  int index,
                  java.lang.Object value)
Sets a particular value of a multivalued header

Parameters:
name - of the header
index - the index of the value to be overwritten
value - the header value
Returns:
true if the header was set

removeHeader

boolean removeHeader(java.lang.String headerName)
Parameters:
headerName - the name of the header to remove from the message
Returns:
true if the header was removed, false if it did not exist

removeHeader

boolean removeHeader(java.lang.String headerName,
                     int index)
Removes a particular value of a multi-valued header

Parameters:
headerName - the name of the header
index - the index of the value to remove (starts with 1)
Returns:
true if the header value was removed, false otherwise

getContent

java.lang.String getContent()
Do not use this method with large payloads as this will load up the entire payload of the message into the memory

Returns:
A entire content of the message as string

Returns:
